title: databrary
text: Databrary powerful tool storing sharing video data documentation researchers. databraryr package, becomes even powerful. Rather interact Databrary web browser, users can write code download participant data even specific files. wrote Databrary API better understand site works hood, streamline analysis data sharing workflows. Let’s get started.

title: databrary
text: Access material Databrary requires prior [registration]https://nyu.databrary.org/user/register) authorization institution. authorization process requires formal agreement institution. ’ll create account ID (email) secure password register. , log new credentials, ’ll select existing institution (list), new institution (isn’t), existing authorized investigator (student, postdoc, collaborator) request authorization .

title: databrary
text: even formal authorization complete, user can access public materials Databrary. vignette, ’ll assume fall category. Databrary assigns unique number person institution system called ‘party id’. run list_people(1:25) asking system provide us information people whose party id’s 1 25. title: databrary
text: Congratulations! institution approved access Databrary’s identifiable data. Now, ’s time set-databraryr can access materials. authorized, gain access much wider range materials Databrary. happens, ’ll load package library(databraryr) run login_db(email = "<YOUR_EMAIL@PROVIDER.COM>"), substituting actual Databrary account <YOUR_EMAIL@PROVIDER.COM>, course. prefer give package name , following thing. first time ’ve logged , asked enter Databrary password separate window. everything works , see Login successful message R console. Congratulations, ready access Databrary’s restricted shared information along private, unshared information access . NOTE: can save time store Databrary login (email) environment variable: Install usethis package via install.packages('usethis'). Run usethis::edit_r_environ(). open .Renviron file new window. Edit .Renviron file adding line DATABRARY_LOGIN="youremail@yourinstitution.edu", substituting actual Databrary log email. Save file, restart R. Now, can run Sys.getenv("DATABRARY_LOGIN") return Databrary login. going forward, can use Sys.getenv("DATABRARY_LOGIN") wherever enter Databrary login: NOTE: can also save even time storing Databrary user account (email) password computer’s secure credentials database using keyring package. keyring package uses encrypted file computer’s operating system uses storing passwords. alternative ways storing user credentials, recommended one. , use store overwrite parameters login_db(): overwrites securely stores credentials, next time log , need use command: ’ve stored email environment variable:
code: databraryr::login_db(email = "<YOUR_EMAIL@PROVIDER.COM>") databraryr::login_db(email = Sys.getenv("DATABRARY_LOGIN")) databraryr::login_db(email = "<YOUR_EMAIL@PROVIDER.COM>", store = TRUE,                      overwrite = TRUE) databraryr::login_db(email = "<YOUR_EMAIL@PROVIDER.COM>") databraryr::login_db(email = Sys.getenv("DATABRARY_LOGIN"))

title: databrary
text: Databrary data library, one specialized storing sharing video. Let’s see use databraryr access data. ’ll start simply. Let’s download test video volume 1 Databrary. download_video() function handles us. Running default parameters downloads simple test video numbers increment. file stored temporary directory created file system using function tempdir(). download_asset() function returns character string full file name. Depending operating system, following commands may open file can play default video player. , can navigate temporary directory open play video manually. Use tempdir() find directory test.mp4 stored. Now, let’s see files shared volume 1. takes moment run many files volume. command returns data frame can manipulate using standard R commands. variables data frame. asset_type variable tells us type data file. can summarize number files using stats::xtabs() function: , lots videos PDFs examine. table ten longest videos.
code: download_video() nums_vid <- download_video() system(paste0("open ", nums_vid)) vol1_df <- list_assets_in_volume() names(vol1_df) #>  [1] "asset_id"       "asset_type_id"  "duration"       "segment"        #>  [5] "name"           "permission"     "size"           "mimetype"       #>  [9] "extension"      "asset_type"     "transcodable"   "classification" unique(vol1_df$asset_type) #> [1] "MPEG-4 video"           "Comma-separated values" "Portable document" stats::xtabs(~ asset_type, data = vol1_df) #> asset_type #> Comma-separated values           MPEG-4 video      Portable document  #>                      1                     14                      1 vol1_df |>   dplyr::filter(asset_type == "MPEG-4 video") |>   dplyr::select(name, duration) |>   dplyr::mutate(hrs = duration/(60*60*1000)) |>   dplyr::select(name, hrs) |>   dplyr::arrange(desc(hrs)) |>   head() |>   knitr::kable(format = 'html')

Assuming logged-, commands show volumes permission equal 1. permission field derives set constants system uses. permission array indexed beginning 0. 1th value “PUBLIC”. , 1 means volumes shown visible public, . title: Interact with the Databrary.org API
text: package active development, documentation. Running devtools::install_github("databrary/databraryr", force=TRUE) regularly get updates strongly recommended.

title: Interact with the Databrary.org API
text: Databrary (databrary.org) research data library specialized storing sharing video capabilities storing types associated data. Access restricted data requires registration formal approval institution. registration process involves creation (email-account-based) user account secure password. institutional authorization granted, user may gain access shared video, audio, data. Many commands databraryr package return meaningful results without prior formal authorization.

code: GET_db_contents(   base_URL = "https://nyu.databrary.org",   URL_components = "/api/volume/1",   convert_JSON = TRUE,   vb = FALSE )

title: Queries the Databrary API with an HTML GET command — GET_db_contents
text: base_URL Base URL API call. Default https://nyu.databrary.org. URL_components components API URL usually assembled using paste0() command. convert_JSON Boolean value. TRUE, convert JSON data frame. Default TRUE. vb Boolean value. TRUE provides verbose output.
